intro: Ceterach lolegnamense, commonly known as the coastal rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that thrives in rocky, sandy, or gravelly soils along the shoreline. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Ceterach lolegnamense plays an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
